<<<<<<< HEAD
Englands Threnodie. Or A briefe and homely discoverie of some jealousies and grievances, under which the kingdom at present groaneth; affectionately tendred by Lady Anglia, to all her dear children, the lovers of their country, and well-willers to truth and peace : especially to her worthy sons, the members of both Houses of Parliament. Ross, Alexander, 1591-1654.
8 p.
Printed by John Macock, [London : 1648]
Caption title. A poem, signed at end: A.R. (i.e. Alexander Ross). Imprint from colophon. Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 10th 1647". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Englands Threnodie. Or A briefe and homely discoverie of some jealousies and grievances, under which the kingdom at present groaneth; affectionately tendred by Lady Anglia, to all her dear children, the lovers of their country, and well-willers to truth and peace : especially to her worthy sons, the members of both Houses of Parliament. Ross, Alexander, 1591-1654.
8 p.
Printed by John Macock, [London : 1648]
Caption title. A poem, signed at end: A.R. (i.e. Alexander Ross). Imprint from colophon. Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 10th 1647". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
